text:
The Prime Minister of Georgia is the most senior minister within the Cabinet of Georgia, appointed by the President of Georgia.
The official title of the Head of the Government of Georgia has changed over time, however, the duties and functions of the leader have changed but a little. The first Prime Minister of Georgia was Noe Ramishvili, the incumbent being Giorgi Gakharia. Georgia has had 40 Prime Ministers since 1918.
